reviewText: It is a really good movie consider how bad the Hong Kong movie industry is right now. This movie brought us back to the old Hong Kong style action movie era. With the twist of the story line, I have to say it is a really good one

It feels like the guys in the movie are "righteous brothers".  Maybe it could have happened in the 80s, but not nowadays.

A drug lord, to exchange for the life of his daughter, let a policeman (Lau, Ching Wan) choose one of his two childhood friends (also policeman) to be released, and Lau chose Louis Koo.  Nick Cheung, who got shot and dropped into the crocodile pond, got saved by the drug lord's daughter and they got married and lived together for five years.

It may suggest that Nick, who felt betrayed by the policeman Lau, and saved by the daughter, might actually live on the side of the drug lord, but no, he was very righteous and he just wanted to give up his life, his wife, and kill the drug lord anyway.  This is very hard to believe and it felt like all three of them are "righteous brothers," which might be the case in the 80s, but not in the 2010s.
Also good action title.  Watch out for a traitor and the double cross
Very Professional Seller , Very Good Package I Would Highly Recommend It.
Love this actor, Louis Koo.  Good story, good action, lots of drama. Very entertaining

Excellent performance from all three main characters.  I watched it twice, the second time was focusing on their performance, especially the scene when they ran into each other with their cars.  Cheung Kah Fai was awesome.  Highly recommend this.  Good script also.

this is a tough movie to review: all the parts and actors but timing is not to my liking. and hey killed off almost everyone I was interested in by the first hours. So my overall ranking would be "I just couldn't get into the overall plot. The characters were great, sorry to see so many get killed off. On the really positive side, another reflection of home life for the cop., I fast forwarded thru that.
fairly good movie. Kept my interest.
